thread.title: Musician denies attacking Michelle McManus with a guitar case - says she is just angry as he refused to DATE her
thread.title_full: Musician denies attacking Michelle McManus with a guitar case - says she is just angry as he refused to DATE her

author: Jennifer Crothers
title: Musician denies attacking Michelle McManus with a guitar case - says she is just angry as he refused to DATE her
text:
Share this video Watch Next 
But when the Mirror's sister paper contacted the man who she claimed was involved he said the incident was “minor”, adding Michelle didn't like him after he refused to date her. 
Des also claimed to have a history with now blonde Michelle saying that she took offence when he wouldn’t play a song for her some years ago. 
He said: "I never hit her with anything. I have no problem with Michelle. She started a problem with me about two, three years ago. 
“She asked to put a song on to my PA. It’s not a pop night. It’s rock or folk, what I would call serious music. (Photo: Facebook) Michelle was hit in the face with a guitar case (Photo: ITV) 
"She took serious offence to that and phoned up the owner of the pub. She’s asked me out about four or five times. I said, ‘No. 
"Every single word that that lassie says should be taken with a pinch of salt. One thing I would never do is hit a woman. 
“Michelle McManus walks around Shawlands thinking she’s something. She is full of s***.” When the Record contacted Michelle for a comment on the incident, she said it had been captured on CCTV. 
She added: “So many people witnessed it. It’s on CCTV. Michelle says the man tried to knock her unconscious (Photo: Rex) Michelle won Pop Idol in 2003 (Photo: Rex) 
“The police are dealing with it and it’s my understanding that he’s been charged.” Police last night said they were still investigating. 
A spokeswoman added: “At 2am, we received a report of a 36-year-old woman being assaulted in Pollokshaws Road in Shawlands. Inquiries are continuing.” 
On Sunday Michelle took to Twitter to describe the alleged incident. She write: “When your life is amazing but then a man you don’t know assaults you for no reason #whatdoesntkillyou xxx” she wrote. 
When asked by another Twitter user what had happened, Michelle claimed, “For no reason he battered me across the face with his guitar case. 
“The police have been amazing, shame about my injured jaw.” 
"He literally tried to knock me unconscious," she claimed on Facebook. Michelle thanked fans for their concern (Photo: twitter/LadyM_McManus) Read More 
“Thank you so much for all of your kind messages,” she tweeted. “Still trying to process what happened to me last night. The police were fantastic.” 
Mirror Online has contacted Michelle’s agent for a comment. 
Michelle was the winner of the second series of Pop Idol in 2003 and scored a number one single with All This Time. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
